title: Exploring Cognitive Penetration in Linguistic Categorization and Perception

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic cognitive psychology and linguistics, foundational knowledge of ERP experimental methodologies
context.additional_context: Learners analyze experimental data using personal devices and empirically investigate the impact of linguistic categorization on visual perception. Project-based assessment evaluates their ability to apply theory to practical cases.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of linguistic categorization on visual attention selection and perceptual processing stages
Learners can interpret neurophysiological evidence of cognitive penetrability effects through ERP data analysis
Learners can understand and apply the importance of variable control (e.g., perceptual experience, visual differences) in experimental design
Learners can compare differences in how linguistic information types (simple labels vs. semantic knowledge) influence categorical perception
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
